creator: Al.Smith@gold.net
text:
OS: IRIX 6.5.18m, C compiler is 7.3.1.3m.

Apache compiled using the following command line:

CC=cc ./configure --prefix=/tmp/apache --with-mpm=worker --enable-rewrite
--enable-expires --enable-usertrack --enable-proxy --enable-so --enable-ssl
--with-ssl=/sys/inet/ssl

When a RewriteRule entry is found of the following form, apache dumps
core when reading the configuration:

RewriteRule   ^/foobar.html$ http://an.other.server/blah/milm.html [P]

Changing to the following removes the problem:

RewriteRule   ^/foobar.html(.*)$ http://an.other.server/blah/milm.html [P]

Have tested on other platforms; solaris 2.6 does not seem to suffer from this
issue.

If you could attach the backtrace from the core dump to this bug report that
would aid debugging immensely
Thanks for using Apache2!
creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
Al.Smith@gold.net
text:
No problem. Attached is the minimal configuration file that provokes this bug
(stored as /tmp/apache/conf/httpd.conf), and the backtrace from running
/tmp/apache/bin/httpd -t.

creator: Al.Smith@gold.net

text:
strange ... it looks like a broken libc (?).

Does it work with the current version (2.0.45)?
creator: nd@perlig.de
Al.Smith@gold.net
text:
Sorry, same problems.

Additionally, I discover that IRIX's /bin/sed isn't able to correctly create 
config.pld during the configuration process.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
This is an old version, and we've had some mod_rewrite updates.  Any better with
2.0.51?

You posted one workaround - so I don't think you can call it a blocker.
But your RewriteRule is really just a ProxyPass in disguise - wouldn't that be a
simpler workaround?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: No response from reporter; apparently a platform clib issue.  Closing.
